blocks.content: Define the rising factorial function. This is the function ` ( A x. ( A + 1 ) x. ... ( A + N ) ) ` for complex ` A ` and nonnegative integers ` N ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 5-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: df-fallfac
blocks.content: Define the falling factorial function. This is the function ` ( A x. ( A - 1 ) x. ... ( A - N ) ) ` for complex ` A ` and nonnegative integers ` N ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 5-Jan-2018.)

thm risefacval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn0)), wceq(co(c0, crisefac, c1), cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cc, c1, cn0, crisefac, cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0))), cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0))), cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0))))
  prodeq2sdv(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, caddc, cv(s0))
  prodeq1d(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  oveq2d(nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1), co(c1, cmin, nat1), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  oveq1(cv(hs1), c1, cmin, nat1)
  df-risefac(hs0, hs1, s0)
  prodex(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
  diff.hs0.c(cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cc)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cn0)
  diff.hs1.c(cprod(s0, co(nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, caddc, cv(s0))))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat0, cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1))
  diff.co.s(s0, cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c1, cmin, nat1)
  diff.cmin.s(s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm risefacval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0)→(c0[RiseFac]c1)= prod(s0 ∈(0[...](c1[-]1)),(c0[+]s0)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cc, c1, cn0, crisefac, prod(s0 ∈(0[...](c1[-]1)),(c0[+]s0)), prod(s0 ∈(0[...](hs1[-]1)),(hs0[+]s0)), prod(s0 ∈(0[...](hs1[-]1)),(c0[+]s0)))
  prodeq2sdv(s0, (0[...](hs1[-]1)), (hs0[+]s0), (c0[+]s0), hs0 = c0)
  oveq1(hs0, c0, caddc, s0)
  prodeq1d(s0, (0[...](hs1[-]1)), (c0[+]s0), (0[...](c1[-]1)), hs1 = c1)
  oveq2d(nat0, cfz, (hs1[-]1), (c1[-]1), hs1 = c1)
  oveq1(hs1, c1, cmin, nat1)
  df-risefac(hs0, hs1, s0)
  prodex(s0, (0[...](c1[-]1)), (c0[+]s0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
  diff.hs0.c(prod(s0 ∈(0[...](c1[-]1)),(c0[+]s0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cc)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cn0)
  diff.hs1.c(prod(s0 ∈(0[...](c1[-]1)),(c0[+]s0)))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat0, cfz, (hs1[-]1))
  diff.co.s(s0, hs1, cmin, nat1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat0, cfz, (c1[-]1))
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c1, cmin, nat1)
  diff.cmin.s(s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  simpl(c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℕ0)
  nn0cnd(hs0, hs0 ∈(0[...](c1[-]1)))

  diff.co.s(s0, c0, caddc, hs0)

  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℕ0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cc)

blocks.name: binomfallfac
blocks.content: A version of the binomial theorem using falling factorials instead of exponentials. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 13-Mar-2018.)

blocks.name: binomrisefac
blocks.content: A version of the binomial theorem using rising factorials instead of exponentials. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 16-Mar-2018.)
